International Association of Geomagnetism and Aeronomy (IAGA)
DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The eleventh generation of the International Geomagnetic Reference Field (IGRF) was adopted in December 2009 by the International Association of Geomagnetism and Aeronomy Working Group V-MOD. It updates the previous IGRF generation with a definitive main field model for epoch 2005.0, a main field model for epoch 2010.0, and a linear predictive secular variation meodel for 2010.0-2015.0.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: This model is updated by IAGA every 5 years

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

Seven teams from the IAGA V-MOD group created independent candidate models for the IGRF-11. The models used the same datasets from satellites and land observatories with different criteria, filters, and processing steps. The various candidate models and their descriptions can be found at http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/vmod/candidatemodels.html

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:code.gco:CharacterString: Processing steps were carried out individually by the developers of the model.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: Individual reports on algorithm and other criteria used should be referenced from the candidate model web page.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The seven models were tested, evaluated, and compared by C.C. Finlay et al. The final model was calculated using weighted means of the candidates. The weights were agreed by a vote of the IGRF-11 task force.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:code.gco:CharacterString: Processing steps were carried out collectively by the developers of the model. The description of the evaluation and weighting process can be found in C.C. Finlay et al "Evaluation of IGRF-11 Candidate Models" in the Journal of Earth, Planets and Space.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: Individual reports on algorithm and other criteria used should be referenced from the candidate model web page.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Challenging Minisatellite Payload (CHAMP) is a German satellite mission dedicated to improving gravity and magnetic field models of the Earth.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Webpage provided details on equipment, mission, as well as results and publications associated with the CHAMP mission.
The Danish satellite Orsted is a dedicated satellite for geomagnetic field modeling.
Webpage provided details on equipment, mission, as well as results and publications associated with the Orsted satellite mission.
Magnetics information that is collected at permanent surface magnetic observatories spread across the globe.
Website provides information on participating institutions, observatory locations, and publications associated with the network of observatories.
